other_tests.findings: Sinus bradycardia, with borderline first-degree atrioventricular block and nonspecific ST-segment and T-wave changes.
Clear cerebrospinal fluid; glucose level 65 mg/dL, protein level 58 mg/dL, no white cells.
Mild scattered periventricular white-matter hyperintensities and a few chronic microhemorrhages.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Progressive increase in hyperintensities in the white matter involving temporal and occipital lobes with development of sulcal effacement and edema during the initial admission.
Progression of the white-matter abnormalities, with development of edema on the MRI during the initial admission.

other_tests.findings: Progression of white-matter abnormalities, with development of white-matter edema.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Edema progressively resolved in subsequent MRI studies acquired 7 days after initial admission.

other_tests.findings: No evidence of acute infarct or new hemorrhage.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Improvement of the white-matter changes and resolution of the edema.

other_tests.findings: Increased number of microhemorrhages, predominantly in the occipital, posterior temporal, and parietal lobes.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Partial resolution of the previously described extensive abnormalities during the second readmission.
